name: Kevin Lee
label: Deputy Chief Credit Officer @ AIG
summary: Marrying insurance markets with credit markets.

highlights: Drive entry and exit discipline in credit underwriting by partnering with clients of captive fronting, loss-sensitive programs, trade finance, political risk insurance, etc., and adjudicating exceptional referrals with the second highest credit authority in the company.

Match the most profitable risks to the most efficient capital on our balance sheet by steering structured credit, infrastructure credit, and fund finance exposures to the correct insurance/investment platform.

Design a scalable operating framework for $100B+ of credit positions in investments and insurance through standardized digital processes, Aladdin integration, and redesign of the technology stack, allowing for more aggression and generation of data that win reinsurance placements.

Anticipate systemic risks, research market controversies, formulate active views quickly, and communicate portfolio implications and corroborating data to insurance and investment teams and senior management.
Took over reinsurance credit team temporarily, outsourced half of team activities, eliminated or automated a quarter of remaining activities, and saved $1.4M.

work_experience.position: Head of Risk, Global Credit & Specialty Insurance
highlights: Led the end-to-end risk management of AIG's $3B global credit & specialty insurance business in turnaround and realignment situations with oversight of catastrophe, financial, operational, and model risks.
Informed the reinsurance progression through construction of exposure profiles and tail scenarios, leading to $0.3B pruning of the aviation book.

Authored annual risk review of business plans for property, credit, and specialty to inform the AIG Board's sign-off, leading to pruning of the programs business and additional resources for other businesses.
Socialized risk-adjusted performance targets to business heads incorporating internal capital and regulatory capital views, and contributed to company ORSA.
Promoted four times in four years; recommended and defended credit ratings of property-casualty, multiline, mortgage, and insurance-linked securities in the US, Bermuda, UK, Europe, and Russia.
Led ratings franchise for $3.3 billion of catastrophe bonds and other insurance-linked securities; partnered with bankers and issuers to design securities that could be rated.

Developed content library by authoring unique credit research including Japan Earthquake Q&A (top-ranked sell-side: “Nicely done and extremely useful”, reposted by Dowling & Partners); Mortgage Insurance (Freddie Mac: “Excellent analysis of the state of the industry”); Sidecars (CEO: “Best research [on the topic] anywhere on the street.”); Reinsurance Buyer Survey (EVP: “unique...nothing similar”)
Drove field execution using controllable income statements to mobilize agency plant, steer pricing, and guide capital allocation; conducted competitive intelligence of rivals.

Managed a run-off book that was a Group CFO watchlist item; negotiated ownership of data, reduced claims leakage by steering claims audits, correctly estimated reserves at 40% ($50 million) less than booked (Division Head: “someone finally got the reserves right”).
